page.title: 08THE RHUALLT BY-PASS.
page.content: {An announcement was made in October {1972 on a by-pass route for Rhuallt, {connected with the improved A55 plan. This original route has since been modified.Thus,at present,four"routes" exist.The route preferred at present, and prior to any inquiry by the Welsh Office,is the ORANGE ROUTE. This begins near Waen crossroads(Sheet 116,1:50000,ref.059749)and,by means of an embankment,crosses the Vale of Clwyd to the south of Rhuallt. The embankment will rise to a maximum height of 15m,this point being over 200m south of the nearest houses. Curving north-east,the route crosses the B5429 in a rock cutting and then the A55, 500 metres east of Rhuallt, continuing on an embankment in the narrow valley and turning east to the present A55,approx.500m east of Ty'r Ali(ref.086758).
